conclusion: The graph is a straight line passing through points (t = –2 s, x/t = 0 m/s) and (t = 0 s, x/t = 10 m/s).
The gradient of the line is (10 – 0)/(0 – (–2)) = 5 (m/s)/s.
For t ≥ 0 s, the line obeys x/t = 10 + 5t.
Multiply by t to obtain the position as a function of time: x = t(10 + 5t) = 10t + 5t².
Differentiate to get the instantaneous speed: v = dx/dt = 10 + 10t.
At the end of the 2nd second (t = 2 s), v = 10 + 10(2) = 30 m/s.
The car’s speed at the end of the 2nd second is 30 m/s.
